articles.title: How Luminar’s doomed Volvo deal helped drag the company into bankruptcy

articles.author: Sean O'Kane

articles.title: WikiFlix shows us what Netflix would have been like 100 years ago
articles.description: On WikiFlix, a Netflix-inspired archive of public domain films, you can watch movies like "It's a Wonderful Life" and "Nosferatu" for free.
articles.author: Amanda Silberling

articles.title: X updates its terms, files countersuit to lay claim to the ‘Twitter’ trademark after newcomer’s challenge
articles.description: X's new terms of service say that no one can use the Twitter name, trademarks, logos, and more without written consent.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Study shows Instacart may be charging some shoppers 20% more for the same product
articles.description: The delivery app has claimed that price testing is part of a longstanding practice in retail sales.
articles.author: Lucas Ropek

articles.title: Slate crosses 150,000 reservations despite waning EV truck enthusiasm
articles.description: It took Slate Auto about seven months to grow its customer list by 50%, but new reservations appear to be outpacing any cancelations.
articles.author: Sean O'Kane

articles.description: Users can view and share photos and comments about restaurants they’ve visited, discover content from others, and follow people just like on any
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: Meta’s AI glasses can now help you hear conversations better
articles.description: Conversation focus uses the AI glasses' open-ear speakers to amplify the voice of the person you're talking to, says Meta.

articles.description: OpenAI rolls out GPT Image 1.5 for ChatGPT, promising 4x faster generation, better instruction-following, and precise edits. The launch escalates its
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Uber Eats alum lands $14M seed from a16z to fix WhatsApp chaos for LatAm’s doctors
articles.description: Leona Health built an AI co-pilot to manage the flood of patient messages Latin American doctors receive on WhatsApp.

articles.title: Google tests an email-based productivity assistant
articles.description: Google's new email-based assistant will be available to AI Pro and Ultra plan users over the age of 18 in North America.

articles.title: Whole Foods to install smart food waste bins from Mill starting in 2027
articles.description: The food waste startup founded by Nest alumnus Matt Rogers also received an investment from Amazon's Climate Pledge Fund.

articles.title: Netflix doubles down on video podcasts with iHeartMedia deal
articles.description: As part of the agreement, Netflix will get a diverse range of shows spanning comedy, crime, history, sports, and more.

articles.title: Canadian peer-to-peer clothing rental company Rax is expanding to the US
articles.description: Rax is a peer-to-peer clothing rental company that won top consumer pitch at Disrupt this year.

articles.title: Instagram brings Reels to the big screen, starting with Amazon Fire TV
articles.description: By bringing Reels to TVs, Instagram can better compete with YouTube, which largely dominates the TV space.

articles.title: Hacking group says it’s extorting Pornhub after stealing users’ viewing data
articles.description: The Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters hacking collective stole Pornhub premium users’ data, including email addresses and viewing history.

articles.title: VCs discuss why most consumer AI startups still lack staying power
articles.description: The next consumer tech revolution may require an introduction of a new personal device.
